function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Asymptomatic infections pose a challenge for disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of routine symptom screening for covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Less accurate antigen rapid tests arts may lead to false negative results, allowing infected individuals to go undetected.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Invasive and uncomfortable nature of rt-pcr tests and arts may discourage individuals from getting tested, leading to undiagnosed cases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of continuous monitoring and automation in detection methods may result in delayed identification of infections and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Minimal involvement from users and healthcare professionals in wearable technology may lead to reliance on technology and potential negligence of other diagnostic and preventive measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid proliferation of wearable technology in the healthcare sector may lead to concerns regarding data privacy and security, leading to potential misuse or unauthorized access to sensitive health information.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of critical appraisal of included papers","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on a broad overview rather than critical appraisal","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wearable technology for early covid-19 detection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scoping reviews on the intersection of wearable technology and covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of search terms and index terms","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider language restrictions in the search strategy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 from real-life subjects involved in wearable technology experiments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data charting and collection involving multiple individuals in close contact.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential inaccuracies in early detection of covid-19 using wearable technology.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through close contact during data collection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High volume of articles and data collection may increase exposure risk to researchers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disagreements between reviewers may result in delays and errors in data interpretation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Anomaly detection models relying on wearable technology data may not be device-agnostic, leading to limitations in generalizability and applicability to different devices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Manual selection of physiological characteristics for anomaly detection model development may lead to biased or incomplete feature sets, impacting the effectiveness of the models.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited external validation of anomaly detection models may result in overfitting to specific datasets, reducing the models’ generalizability and reliability.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unsupervised machine learning used to segment data into infectious and noninfectious periods, leading to potential misclassification of covid-19 infection periods.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of validation standards for wearable technology used in early detection of covid-19, leading to inconsistent accuracy results and unreliable performance.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent accuracy results and heterogenous specificity and sensitivity values in wearable technology for covid-19 detection, leading to uncertainty in the performance of the technology.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wearable technology not being device-agnostic and unable to distinguish covid-19 infection from other diagnoses","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shortcomings in data preparation such as manual feature selection, limited features, and infrequent use of data augmentation and external validation methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underrepresentation of geographic regions beyond the united states and small sample sizes in study characteristics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases spread through skin contact with sensors or wearables","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor contact with skin leading to compromised sensor accuracy","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Skin irritation and discomfort from prolonged wear of sensors and wearables","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate early detection due to reliance on limited physiological indicators leading to delayed diagnosis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Radiation exposure risks from chest radiography imaging for covid-19 diagnosis.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spectrum bias in adms due to underrepresentation of geographic regions and population samples, leading to inaccurate predictions and diagnoses.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spectrum bias perpetuates the inability to distinguish covid-19 from illnesses with similar presentations.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small sample sizes increase the effect of overfitting in validation methods.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adm performance may be overoptimistic due to overfitting and lack of generalizability.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unreliable self-reported symptom onset for covid-19 infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overfitting of algorithmic detection methods adms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in conducting diagnostic test accuracy systematic review","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quality appraisal for included articles in the scoping review","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation in search results due to lack of a chinese database","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear universal applicability of results due to study settings favoring the united states","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mandating the use of low-cost softs for remote surveillance of travelers and susceptible populations could lead to privacy concerns and data security risks.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate performance and lack of validation standards for softs can lead to false detection alerts and misdiagnosis, compromising public trust in the technology.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on wearable technology for early detection of covid-19 without clinical reliability may lead to complacency and lack of adherence to other preventive measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access nodes may cause overcrowding at the remaining access points, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporary closure of access points may lead to altered behavior of individuals, potentially increasing the risk of non-compliance with safety measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"One-way mobility circulation may cause congestion and bottlenecks at entry and exit points, increasing the risk of close contact and disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unchecked mobility in public places leading to potential disease spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
